oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-06-04 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 4, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Don Gibson (host/performer), guest performers the Louvin Brothers, and regular performers Archie Campbell, the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl (who will appear on the Tennessee Ernie Ford show June 16th), and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1078th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Don Gibson; Archie Campbell; Louvin Brothers; Jordanaires; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Don Gibson -- Just One Time (Don Gibson, Jordanaires) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Don Gibson introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Don Gibson) -- Don Gibson and Grant Turner introduce the Louvin Brothers -- I See A Bridge (Louvin Brothers, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Don Gibson) -- Don Gibson introduces Tommy Jackson -- Sally Gooden (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner introduces Don Gibson -- Lord I'm Coming Home (Don Gibson, Jordanaires) -- Don Gibson introduces Chet Atkins -- April In Portugal (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Jackson, Tommy; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jordanaires (Musical group); Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003; Louvin Brothers; Louvin, Charlie, 1927-2011; Louvin, Ira, 1924-1965
